00060 #ifndef _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
00061 #define _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
00062 
00063 #include <vector>
00064 
00065 /** Kuka namespace */
00066 namespace KUKA
00067 {
00068 namespace FRI
00069 {
00070 
00071    // forward declaration
00072    struct ClientData;
00073 
00074    /**
00075     * \brief Abstract FRI transformation client. 
00076     * 
00077     * A transformation client enables the user to send transformation matrices cyclically to the 
00078     * KUKA Sunrise controller for manipulating the transformations of dynamic frames in the
00079     * Sunrise scenegraph.
00080     * Usually, these matrices will be provided by external sensors. 
00081     * <br>
00082     * Custom transformation clients have to be derived from this class and need to
00083     * implement the provide() callback. This callback is called once by the
00084     * client application whenever a new FRI message arrives.
00085     * 
00086     * <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b> 
00087     */
00088    class TransformationClient
00089    {
00090       
00091       friend class ClientApplication;
00092      
00093    public:
00094       
00095       /**
00096        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br> 
00097        * \brief Constructor.
00098        **/
00099       TransformationClient();
00100       
00101       /** <br> <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>   <br> 
00102        * \brief Virtual destructor. 
00103        **/
00104       virtual ~TransformationClient();
00105       
00106       /** 
00107        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00108        * \brief Callback which is called whenever a new FRI message arrives. 
00109        *
00110        *  In this callback all requested transformations have to be set.
00111        *  
00112        *  \see getRequestedTransformationIDs(), setTransformation()
00113        */
00114       virtual void provide() = 0;
00115       
00116       
00117    protected:
00118 
00119       /** 
00120        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00121        * \brief  Returns a vector of identifiers of all requested transformation matrices.
00122        * 
00123        * The custom TransformationClient has to provide data for transformation matrices with these
00124        * identifiers. 
00125        * 
00126        * @return reference to vector of IDs of requested transformations
00127        */
00128       const std::vector<const char*>& getRequestedTransformationIDs() const;
00129       
00130       /** 
00131        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00132        * 
00133        * \brief Get the timestamp of the current received FRI monitor message in Unix time. 
00134        * 
00135        * This method returns the seconds since 0:00, January 1st, 1970 (UTC).
00136        * Use getTimestampNanoSec() to increase your timestamp resolution when
00137        * seconds are insufficient. 
00138        * 
00139        * @return timestamp encoded as Unix time (seconds)
00140        */
00141       const unsigned int getTimestampSec() const;
00142       
00143       /** 
00144        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00145        * \brief Get the nanoseconds elapsed since the last second (in Unix time).
00146        * 
00147        * This method complements getTimestampSec() to get a high resolution 
00148        * timestamp. 
00149        * 
00150        * @return timestamp encoded as Unix time (nanoseconds part)
00151        */
00152       const unsigned int getTimestampNanoSec() const;
00153       
00154       /**
00155        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00156        * \brief Provides a requested transformation matrix.
00157        * 
00158        * A transformation matrix has 3x4 elements. It consists of a rotational matrix (3x3 elements)
00159        * and a translational vector (3x1 elements). The complete transformation matrix has the
00160        * following structure: <br>
00161        * [Transformation(3x4)] = [Rotation(3x3) | Translation(3x1) ]
00162        * <p>
00163        * All provided transformation matrices need a timestamp that corresponds to their
00164        * time of acquisiton. This timestamp must be synchronized to the timestamp
00165        * provided by the KUKA Sunrise controller (see getTimestampSec(), getTimestampNanoSec()).
00166        * <p>
00167        * If an update to the last transformation is not yet available when the provide()
00168        * callback is executed, the last transformation (including its timestamp) should be
00169        * repeated until a new transformation is available. 
00170        *  
00171        * @param transformationID Identifier string of the transformation matrix
00172        * @param transformationMatrix Provided transformation matrix
00173        * @param timeSec Timestamp encoded as Unix time (seconds)
00174        * @param timeNanoSec Timestamp encoded as Unix time (nanoseconds part)
00175        */
00176       void setTransformation(const char* transformationID, double transformationMatrix[3][4],
00177             unsigned int timeSec, unsigned int timeNanoSec);
00178       
00179    private: 
00180       
00181       ClientData* _data;   //!< the client data structure
00182             
00183       /**
00184        * \brief Method to link the client data structure (used internally).
00185        * 
00186        * @param clientData the client data structure
00187        */
00188       void linkData(ClientData* clientData);
00189       
00190    };
00191    
00192 }
00193 }
00194 
00195 #endif // _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
